title: Duplicate chair-table set 3 times on the right side of the 3D cafe scene

requirements.text: In the full caf√© environment (frontend/src/scene/environment/CafeEnvironment.tsx), duplicate the existing table + 4-chair seating set and add 3 additional identical sets placed in the right-side area of the room (positive X side), ensuring each set has a clear gap from walls and from other furniture and does not overlap other seating sets.

quotes: Good now simply copy this chair table set and paste 3 just like these in the right side area

acceptanceCriteria: CafeEnvironment renders the original seating set plus 3 additional duplicated seating sets (total 4 table+chair sets).
All 3 new seating sets are placed on the right side of the room (positive X) and are visibly separated (no z-fighting/overlap) from each other and from existing props.
For each new seating set, all 4 chairs are rotated to face toward their corresponding table (matching the current orientation behavior of the original set).

requirements.text: In the fallback environment (frontend/src/scene/environment/BasicCafeRoomFallback.tsx), duplicate the existing table + 4-chair seating set and add the same 3 additional identical sets placed in the right-side area (positive X side), keeping chair rotations facing their table.

quotes: Good now simply copy this chair table set and paste 3 just like these in the right side area

acceptanceCriteria: BasicCafeRoomFallback renders the original seating set plus 3 additional duplicated seating sets (total 4 table+chair sets).
All 3 new seating sets are placed on the right side of the fallback room (positive X) with no visible overlaps.
For each new seating set, all 4 chairs face toward their corresponding table.

constraints: Do not modify any backend Motoko canister code for this change.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Adding new furniture models beyond duplicating the existing table and wooden chair components.
Changing materials, lighting, textures, or navigation controls.
